title: Motorcycling-Yamaha are struggling, says MotoGP great Rossi
text: February 19, 2018 / 5:23 PM / Updated an hour ago Motorcycling - Yamaha are struggling, says MotoGP great Rossi Reuters Staff 2 Min Read (Reuters) - The evidence from MotoGP’s two pre-season tests so far is that Yamaha are struggling, according to Valentino Rossi and Maverick Vinales. Italian great Rossi, the nine-times world champion who turned 39 last week, was 12th in the combined timesheets after the latest test in Thailand while his Spanish team mate was eighth. Vinales had been seventh and Rossi ninth at the previous three-day test in Malaysia. “It was a difficult test, we struggled and we have to improve because we didn’t improve a lot compared to last year,” the MotoGP.com website quoted Rossi as saying after the sessions at Thailand’s new Buriram circuit. FILE PHOTO - Sport Motorcycling - Movistar Yamaha Team Presentation - Madrid, Spain - January 24, 2018 Movistar Yamaha's MotoGP rider Maverick Vinales of Spain poses with his new bike for the 2018 racing season. REUTERS/Susana Vera “Especially with the electronics, so I think we have a lot of work to do.” Vinales, who finished third overall last year, said the factory Yamaha team needed to improve in all areas with rivals Honda and Ducati setting the pace so far in 2018 after also battling for the title last year. While Yamaha’s main riders have found their bike lacking grip, the non-factory Tech3 team have looked much more on the pace, with Frenchman Johann Zarco second fastest at the Thai test. Rossi is hoping for improvements at final testing starting on March 1 in Qatar, venue of the season’s opening race on March 18. “At the moment we’re struggling,” he said. “But this is today. Maybe in Qatar it will be better.” Reporting by Alan Baldwin; Editing by Kevin Liffey
